intro: Laennecia eriophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf or woollyleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and the plant produces pods that contain several seeds. Laennecia eriophylla is adapted to arid environments and has mechanisms to conserve water, making it resilient in harsh conditions.
